location.name: Cahaba Brewing
location.customerAnnouncements:
Must be 21 years old or older and a valid Government ID is required for pickup. 

Per current ABC regulation we can only sell 288oz of beer and 3 bottles of spirits per person per day.

6-pack - 72oz, Growler - 64oz, Crowler - 32oz


Hours for In-Store Pickup:

Monday-Thursday 3:00 PM - 9:00 PM

Friday & Saturday 12:00 PM - 11:00 PM

Sunday 12:00 PM - 7:00 PM


﻿Thank you for supporting Cahaba Brewing!

delivery.deliveryInstructions: This text is displayed on the delivery order confirmation page in Arryved and is to give instructions for how/when to get a delivery order. 1000 max characters.
delivery.deliveryZoneDescription:
This text will be shown to customers when they receive their delivery instructions.
Example: "We deliver anywhere in town North of the river".

served.inPersonInstructionsPrompt:
Example: "What table number are you at?
Table numbers are taped to the table. Speak to a server if you are at a location with no table number."
served.inPersonConfirmationInstructions: This text is displayed on the in person order confirmation page in Arryved and is to give instructions for how/when to get a delivery order.

availableItems.description: The most notorious of Cahaba’s brews, this drinkable beer has an IBU of just 23. Our Blonde Ale is brewed with an unmistakable blend of European malts and hops, resulting in a clean finish. Blonde is light-bodied with just enough malt and hop to keep your interest.
Crystal clear and refreshing, this sour has a little sourness and a nice saltiness that will transport you to a hot day on the beach.
Our Cinematic Sour is a Berliner Weisse fruited with passion fruit and pink guava giving it a tropical, sweet, and fruity finish.
Without being too sour, DD’s Cherry Hibiscus Sour has a nice sweetness from the cherry and hibiscus. Extremely light and effervescent, enjoy this beer on draft while you can!

Proudly introducing your new favorite beer: CAHABA LAGER This lager is medium bodied yet not too heavy with simple ingredients yet brewed complexity. Saaz hops, pilsner malt, and flaked maize give this beer a sweet taste that finishes dry. Find balance in your life with Cahaba Lager!

An American IPA in the truest sense. The straightforward Oka Uba is loaded up with classic hops at the end of the boil and then dry hopped for an earthy and slightly citrusy flavor and aroma. This gorgeous IPA illuminates an orange and red hue in the light. It is a staple of both our community and our Taproom. The name is derived from the indigenous word for the Cahaba river and can be translated to “the Water Above”.

Don’t let the low gravity fool you! Our American Pale Ale is as surprisingly full-bodied and flavorful as a “small” beer can be. With plenty of malt character and a great mouth feel, don’t be surprised at the good head retention in your pint glass. A bready finish follows the refreshingly subtle hop character and floral aroma for a perfectly balanced session beer. Drink it down and admire the lacing when it’s done.
Our After Dinner is a Berliner Weisse fruited with peaches and blackberries. This seasonal sour has well rounded tart, crisp finish.

The most notorious of Cahaba’s brews, this drinkable beer has an IBU of just 23. Our Blonde Ale is brewed with an unmistakable blend of European malts and hops, resulting in a clean finish. Blonde is light-bodied with just enough malt and hop to keep your interest.
Crystal clear and refreshing, this sour has a little sourness and a nice saltiness that will transport you to a hot day on the beach.
Our Cinematic Sour is a Berliner Weisse fruited with passion fruit and pink guava giving it a tropical, sweet, and fruity finish.

This take on a classic dry Irish Stout is available in cans every Winter, but you will find this on draft throughout the year. It is full of the roasted barley, malt character, and smoothness expected from the style, but with a subtle fruitiness reminiscent of the Irish yeast used. This beer pours with a satisfyingly dark color and surprisingly light body. The Irish Stout is roasty on the front with a chocolatey finish.

Proudly introducing your new favorite beer: CAHABA LAGER This lager is medium bodied yet not too heavy with simple ingredients yet brewed complexity. Saaz hops, pilsner malt, and flaked maize give this beer a sweet taste that finishes dry. Find balance in your life with Cahaba Lager!

An American IPA in the truest sense. The straightforward Oka Uba is loaded up with classic hops at the end of the boil and then dry hopped for an earthy and slightly citrusy flavor and aroma. This gorgeous IPA illuminates an orange and red hue in the light. It is a staple of both our community and our Taproom. The name is derived from the indigenous word for the Cahaba river and can be translated to “the Water Above”.

Don’t let the low gravity fool you! Our American Pale Ale is as surprisingly full-bodied and flavorful as a “small” beer can be. With plenty of malt character and a great mouth feel, don’t be surprised at the good head retention in your pint glass. A bready finish follows the refreshingly subtle hop character and floral aroma for a perfectly balanced session beer. Drink it down and admire the lacing when it’s done.
German tart blackberry wheat beer with a dry fruity finish

Single Malt & Single Hop Pale Ale
Featuring Azacca Hops
Toasted Malt, Slightly Sweet, Toffee
This growler can hold 64 ounces of liquid and contains the Surgeon General’s warning.
Put 'em anywhere! Bags, shirts, hats! Makes a great gift or stocking stuffer!
The perfect pint glass to hold your favorite Cahaba brew! Add one to your collection today!
Bring a little bit of Cahaba Brewing Company home to your own wall with one of our tin tacker signs! Perfect as a gift or for your own in-home bar!
Limited edition 2020 Oktoberfest T-Shirt
